knowledge_base.answer: If you accidentally consume an allergen, stop eating immediately and assess your symptoms. If severe, use an epinephrine injector if prescribed and seek medical help.

If you love spicy food, try Kolhapuri Chicken, Andhra Chilli Chicken, or Spicy Paneer Tikka! Each one is packed with bold flavors.
A delicious vegetarian meal could be Paneer Butter Masala with Tandoori Roti, Rajma Chawal, or the smoky Baingan Bharta.
Classic North Indian dishes include the creamy Dal Makhani, rich Butter Chicken, fluffy Chole Bhature, and crisp Tandoori Roti.
Start your morning with a South Indian favorite: soft Idlis with coconut chutney, crispy Masala Dosa, Pongal, or a bowl of warm Upma.
For a light yet satisfying meal, go for Moong Dal Khichdi, Poha with peanuts, or a warm bowl of Tomato Soup.
If you're avoiding dairy, you can enjoy Baingan Bharta, Tandoori Roti, fragrant Vegan Biryani, or the protein-rich Chana Masala.
For a gluten-free meal, you can try Besan Chilla, comforting Rajma Chawal, or a crispy Masala Dosa.
Need protein? Go for grilled chicken with sautéed veggies, Dal Tadka with brown rice, or a refreshing Sprouts Salad.
West India is known for its bold flavors! Enjoy Pav Bhaji from Mumbai, crunchy Dhokla from Gujarat, spicy Vada Pav, or the tangy Goan Fish Curry.
Stay healthy with Palak Soup, a protein-packed Sprouts Chaat, or fiber-rich Oats Upma.
You can try aromatic Chicken Biryani, flavorful Rogan Josh, or a coastal special like Fish Curry.
East India’s cuisine offers Litti Chokha from Bihar, Pakhala Bhata from Odisha, and the sweet delight of Mishti Doi from Bengal.
Kids love the cheesy goodness of Paneer Paratha, mildly spiced Vegetable Pulao, and crispy Cheese Dosa.
For a great start to the day, try Poha with a squeeze of lemon, flaky Paratha with curd, or nutritious Rava Upma.
A fast and tasty snack? Try Bhel Puri for something crunchy, Dhokla for something soft, or Aloo Chaat for a tangy treat.
For a satisfying dinner, try comforting Dal Tadka with Roti, well-seasoned Grilled Fish, or deliciously stuffed Capsicum.
Watching your calories? Opt for a bowl of Palak Soup, light Vegetable Stir Fry, or nutritious Methi Thepla.
South Indian favorites include crispy Masala Dosa, tangy Sambar Rice, and fluffy Appam with coconut-based Stew.
Satisfy your sweet tooth with Gulab Jamun, soft Rasgulla, or the rich flavors of Moong Dal Halwa!
Maharashtra’s specialties include the spicy Misal Pav, sweet Puran Poli, and fasting favorite Sabudana Khichdi.
Enjoy authentic Punjabi flavors with Sarson Da Saag and Makki Di Roti or the flaky Amritsari Kulcha!
Want something spicy and tangy? Try Pani Puri, Chaat with tamarind chutney, or crispy Gobi Manchurian.
Relish famous street foods like Vada Pav from Mumbai, steaming hot Momos, or buttery Pav Bhaji.
Warm up this winter with Sarson Da Saag, delicious Gajar Halwa, and a piping hot bowl of Rasam.
Beat the heat with Buttermilk, a refreshing Watermelon Salad, and cool Curd Rice.
Indulge in the creaminess of Shahi Paneer, velvety Malai Kofta, or classic Butter Chicken.
Celebrate festivals with Gujiya on Holi, Modak for Ganesh Chaturthi, and Seviyan for Eid.
Keep it healthy with Quinoa Salad, fiber-rich Vegetable Soup, or Grilled Paneer with sautéed veggies.
Maharashtra’s must-try dishes include the spicy Misal Pav, crispy Bhakarwadi, and comforting Puran Poli.
Fasting? Try wholesome Sabudana Khichdi, nutritious Rajgira Roti, or sweet and energy-packed Shengdana Ladoo.
Enjoy North India’s best with creamy Butter Chicken, rich Dal Makhani, crisp Chole Bhature, and smoky Paneer Tikka.
Lunch ideas: Enjoy Rajma Chawal, tangy Sambar Rice, or a flavorful Veg Biryani.
Fuel up with high-protein foods like Grilled Chicken, a crunchy Sprouts Salad, or soft Paneer Bhurji.
Healthy vegetarian options include nutrient-rich Palak Soup, wholesome Moong Dal, and fiber-loaded Oats Upma.
Try Maharashtra’s best: spicy Misal Pav, the festive Puran Poli, crispy Bhakarwadi, and street favorite Vada Pav.
Here are some must-try dishes: aromatic Biryani, cheesy Pizza, creamy Pasta, crispy Dosa, or flavorful Paneer Butter Masala.
Want something tasty? Try comforting Rajma Chawal, flavorful Dal Tadka, indulgent Chole Bhature, or rich Butter Chicken!
Craving a good meal? How about sizzling Grilled Fish, soft Tandoori Roti with curry, or a refreshing Salad Bowl?
Feeling hungry? Let me know if you're in the mood for something spicy, sweet, or healthy, and I'll suggest the best option!
Enjoy the rainy season with hot Pakoras, spicy Bhajiya, and a cup of Masala Chai!
For a protein boost, try Dal Tadka, Chana Masala, or a nutrient-rich Sprouts Salad.
When you're unwell, try a bowl of Khichdi, warm Tomato Soup, or fresh Ginger Tea for comfort.
Strengthen your immunity with Turmeric Milk, Citrus fruits, Garlic-infused dishes, and a bowl of hot Rasam.
India is famous for Butter Chicken, Biryani, Masala Dosa, and Paneer Butter Masala!
Delhi’s must-try street foods include Chole Bhature, Aloo Tikki, and spicy Golgappa!
Try a fluffy Masala Omelette, Egg Bhurji, or a classic Egg Curry.
Gain weight healthily with Avocado Toast, Peanut Butter Smoothie, and Ghee-laden Parathas.
Try soft Moong Dal Khichdi, a bowl of Curd Rice, or light Steamed Vegetables.
Quick and easy options include Aloo Poha, Bread Upma, and Masala Maggi.
Enjoy a romantic meal with creamy Pasta, a classic Paneer Tikka, or a luxurious Butter Chicken.
Coconut lovers can enjoy Kerala-style Avial, Coconut Ladoo, or Goan Fish Curry.
Stay cool with Buttermilk, Watermelon Juice, and fresh Cucumber Salad.
If you love spice, try Misal Pav, Kolhapuri Chicken, and fiery Thecha!
Need something easy? Have a bowl of Curd Rice, quick Bread Toast, or instant Rava Upma.
Good for digestion: Jeera Water, Ginger Tea, and simple Moong Dal Khichdi.
Try unsweetened Oats, Chia Pudding, or fresh fruit salad without sugar.
You can enjoy aromatic Biryani, creamy Curd Rice, or the simple Lemon Rice.
Rajasthani flavors shine in Dal Baati Churma, Laal Maas, and Ker Sangri!
Boost energy with Dry Fruit Ladoo, Banana Smoothie, or wholesome Sprouts Chaat.
Fuel up with Banana Oats Smoothie, Peanut Butter Toast, or a protein-rich Egg Wrap.
Try crunchy Samosa, crispy Spring Rolls, or deep-fried Medu Vada!
Enjoy a late-night snack like Cheese Sandwich, instant Maggi, or a handful of Nuts.
Iron-rich foods include Palak Paneer, Black Chana, and Bajra Roti.
Pair your tea with crispy Mathri, spicy Bhajiya, or a plate of warm Samosas.
Here are some must-try dishes: aromatic Biryani, cheesy Pizza, creamy Pasta, crispy Dosa, or flavorful Paneer Butter Masala.
Yes, Kaju Katli is made primarily from cashews. Please avoid it if you have a nut allergy.
No, traditional Dosa is cooked with oil. However, some variants may use butter. Please confirm while ordering.
Yes, Shahi Tukda may be garnished with dry fruits. Please ask for a nut-free version if required.
Yes, Dhokla is often tempered with mustard seeds. Please inform us if you need a mustard-free version.
No, Chicken Korma may include cashews or almonds in its gravy. Please request a nut-free version if required.
Yes, Tikka Masala is often finished with cream. You can request a dairy-free option if required.
No, Seekh Kebab is traditionally egg-free. Please confirm if you have dietary restrictions.
No, Chicken 65 is generally egg-free, but some recipes may use egg for crispiness. Please confirm before ordering.
Yes, Veg Rolls often contain mayonnaise, which may have eggs. You can request an egg-free version if required.
No, Veg Pakora is traditionally egg-free, prepared with gram flour.
No, Rabdi is typically made from milk and sugar without nuts. However, some variations may include dry fruits.
No, Gajar Halwa does not typically contain nuts unless added for garnishing. You can request a nut-free version if required.
Yes, Manchow Soup typically includes soy sauce. For a soy-free option, please inform us while ordering.
No, Rajma Masala may include ghee or butter. Please ask for an oil-based preparation for a dairy-free option.
Yes, Poha often includes peanuts for added crunch. If you have a peanut allergy, please ask for a peanut-free version.
Yes, Tomato Soup often contains cream for richness. You can request a dairy-free version if required.
No, Pav typically contains milk or butter. For a vegan version, you can request a special preparation.
No, Pani Puri is traditionally made with natural ingredients. Please ask for specific details if you have concerns.
Yes, Bhature dough may include yogurt or milk. You can request a dairy-free version if required.
Yes, Pista Kulfi contains pistachios and almonds. Please avoid it if you have a nut allergy.
Yes, Chicken Tikka Masala may contain cashew or almond paste in the gravy. Kindly ask for a nut-free version if required.
No, Motichoor Ladoo is typically nut-free but may be garnished with almonds. Please confirm while ordering.
No, Malai Kulfi is egg-free but contains dairy. Please avoid it if you're lactose intolerant.
Yes, Gajar Halwa is typically cooked with ghee for richness. Please request an oil-based version if required.
Yes, traditional Pav is often made with milk or butter for softness. If you need a dairy-free option, please request vegan Pav.
Yes, Malai Kofta contains cream, milk, and paneer. You can request a dairy-free version if required.
Yes, Palak Paneer often includes cream for richness. Please ask for a dairy-free version if required.
No, Tandoori Roti is traditionally made with wheat flour and is not gluten-free. Please ask for gluten-free options if available.
Yes, some Chicken Soups may include soy sauce. You can request a soy-free version if required.
Some regional Chicken Curry recipes include coconut milk. Please confirm while placing your order.
Yes, Bhindi Masala may include mustard seeds. You can request a mustard-free version if required.
Yes, Kachori filling often includes onions and garlic. Please ask for a Jain or Satvik version if required.
Yes, Chicken Biryani is typically marinated in yogurt. Please ask for a dairy-free preparation if required.
Yes, Dal Makhani is rich in butter and cream. Please request a dairy-free option if needed.
Yes, some restaurants offer vegan Pav Bhaji using plant-based butter. Please confirm before ordering.
Yes, Misal Pav is typically spicy, but we can adjust the spice level upon request.
There are dairy-free products: Dhokla, Pani Puri, Aloo Tikki.
There are nut-free products: Samosa, Pav Bhaji, Dhokla.
There are gluten-free products: Chicken Tikka, Palak Paneer, Dal Tadka.

We offer flexible meal subscription plans, including Single Meal, Two Meals, and Three Meals per day. Durations include Weekly (7 Days), Bi-Weekly (14 Days), and Monthly (30 Days).

Pricing varies based on the plan: Single Meal (Weekly: ₹500, Bi-Weekly: ₹950, Monthly: ₹2,000), Two Meals (Weekly: ₹900, Bi-Weekly: ₹1,750, Monthly: ₹3,600), Three Meals (Weekly: ₹1,300, Bi-Weekly: ₹2,500, Monthly: ₹5,000).
Yes, we offer customized meal plans, including Special Diet, High-Protein Diet, and Keto/Vegan options. Pricing differs based on meal type and duration.
Yes, meal preferences (vegetarian, non-vegetarian, or customized diet plans) can be changed 48 hours in advance.
Delivery timings can be scheduled according to your convenience within our available time slots.

Cancellations before the subscription start date receive a full refund. Cancellations after the start date will be refunded based on remaining days minus a 10% processing fee. No refunds for cancellations within the last 3 days. Skipped meals must be reported 24 hours in advance.
Renewal notifications will be sent via email, SMS, and in-app notifications at least 3 days before the renewal date, ensuring you have ample time to make any necessary changes or cancellations.
All subscriptions are set to auto-renew unless canceled before the renewal date. You will receive a notification 3 days prior to renewal. Auto-renewal can be disabled in the account settings.
For any subscription-related queries, cancellations, or modifications, please contact us at [Your Support Email] or call [Your Support Phone Number].

The subscription pricing varies based on the plan selected. For single meals: ₹500 (7 days), ₹950 (14 days), ₹2000 (30 days). For three meals a day: ₹1300 (7 days), ₹2500 (14 days), ₹5000 (30 days). Customized meal plans are also available at different rates.
Subscribers enjoy exclusive discounts on meals, priority delivery slots, early access to seasonal and promotional offers

Yes! We accept UPI payments via Google Pay, PhonePe, Paytm. Just select UPI at checkout and enter your UPI ID to complete the transaction.
At checkout, select UPI payment and enter your Google Pay or PhonePe UPI ID. You will receive a payment request in your app—just approve it, and you're done!
Yes! You can securely save your UPI ID, card details, or wallet information for faster checkouts in the future.
Absolutely! We use secure payment gateways with encryption to keep your transactions safe and private.
Yes! You can use Google Pay (GPay) for your payment.
Yes! We supports multiple online payment methods. You can choose your preferred option at checkout.
Yes, we accept Visa, Mastercard, and RuPay debit/credit cards.
Currently, we support Paytm UPI but not Paytm Wallet. You can use Paytm UPI to complete your payment.
The Cash on Delivery (COD) option is only available for orders below ₹1000. If your order exceeds this amount, please use UPI, cards, or net banking to complete the payment.
Currently, we do not support card payments on delivery. If you prefer using a card, please complete the payment online before placing your order.
Currently, we support UPI transactions via PhonePe, Google Pay, and Paytm but do not accept digital wallets like Amazon Pay or Paytm Wallet.
At the moment, we do not offer EMI or Pay Later options. However, you can use a credit card to complete your purchase.
Currently, we only accept Indian-issued Visa, Mastercard, and RuPay cards. International cards are not supported.
No, we only accept payments in Indian Rupees (INR). If you're using an international card, your bank may convert the amount based on the exchange rate.
Yes, we accept Mastercard. You can complete your payment using Mastercard.
Yes, we accept Visa Credit or Debit Cards. You can complete your payment using Visa Card.
Yes, we accept RuPay Credit or Debit Cards. You can complete your payment using RuPay Card.
Yes! You can use Net Banking  to complete your payment.

Here are our available cuisines: North Indian, South Indian, Chinese, Continental, and Street Food. Each cuisine offers a variety of vegetarian and non-vegetarian options. Would you like to explore a specific cuisine?

Taste of India is a premium Indian restaurant offering authentic dishes from across India. We specialize in traditional recipes prepared with fresh ingredients and serve both vegetarian and non-vegetarian options. Our menu includes tandoori specialties, curries, biryanis, and more.
